roles.title: The King
roles.description: The head of state, a symbolic role.

roles.title: The Governor-General
roles.description: The King's representative in New Zealand.

roles.title: The Prime Minister
roles.description: The head of government, leads the country.

roles.title: An MP
roles.description: A Member of Parliament, elected to represent voters.

roles.title: A Voter
roles.description: A citizen who votes in elections.

powers.title: Signs bills into law
powers.description: Gives royal assent to make bills into Acts of Parliament.

powers.title: Commands the army
powers.description: Is the Commander-in-Chief of the armed forces.

powers.title: Chooses the Prime Minister
powers.description: Appoints the person who can command a majority in the House.

powers.title: Decides guilt or innocence
powers.description: Presides over court cases and makes legal rulings.

powers.title: Represents NZ overseas
powers.description: Acts as the country's representative on the world stage.

powers.title: Runs the government day-to-day
powers.description: Manages the country's administration and public services.

powers.title: Debates and votes on laws
powers.description: Participates in the legislative process in Parliament.
